data.name: farmfriendlincs
data.tweet: @wmarybeard @HSBC_UK @MetroBank_Help The finances of the Post Office have been effectively wrecked by their past management in the Post Office computer scandal and no one has been held accountable.

data.name: farmfriendlincs
data.tweet: @wmarybeard @HSBC_UK @MetroBank_Help The battle now is to keep cash available and that will only happen in my  opinion if the Post Office is nationalised and  their network is subsidized by either public funds or a levy on the Banks.

data.name: farmfriendlincs
data.tweet: @wmarybeard @HSBC_UK @MetroBank_Help Having worked for Barclays for 33 years I feel the consumer has got what they wanted through a race to the bottom on price where everyone wants everything for free and on a mobile phone. Banking is a shrinking industry.

data.name: farmfriendlincs
data.tweet: @wmarybeard @HSBC_UK @MetroBank_Help When I needed to open an association account for a group of farmers only Metro Bank and Barclays were prepared to consider it out of 20 banks approached and Barclays could not even make an appointment for six weeks, Metro could deal with me almost immediately.

data.name: farmfriendlincs
data.tweet: @wmarybeard @HSBC_UK @MetroBank_Help is the ONLY UK Bank that it is relatively easy to go into and talk to someone. And they open on Sunday. Brilliant service, albeit limited on number to cities in middle and southern England. https://t.co/vri3XZlsVa
